headline: Slurmit The Frog: +1,931% in 24 Hours, 44,649 Transactions, and Solana's Frog Meta Just Got Weirder
subheadline: A brand-new frog meme coin on Pump.fun hit $3.3M volume before most traders knew it existed. Is this the next viral launch — or exit liquidity dressed in a frog suit?
author: MemeDesk Editorial

tokenData.name: Slurmit The Frog
tokenData.recentAction: +1,931% in 24h with $3.3M volume and 44,649 transactions on Solana

body.text: Something froggy this way comes. Slurmit The Frog ($Slurmit) materialized on Solana's Pump.fun ecosystem sometime in the last 24 hours and immediately went feral — posting a +1,931% price surge, racking up 44,649 transactions, and pulling $3.3M in volume before most degens had their morning coffee. The frog meme meta on Solana never really died. It just waits.

bullets: Slurmit The Frog hit +1,931% in 24 hours on Solana with $3.3M volume and 44,649 transactions — one of the biggest raw launch surges on DexScreener right now
Market cap sits at $728K with $78K liquidity — still micro, which means this is either the beginning or the exit window
56% buy-side on txns signals mixed intent: genuine community building or slow distribution by early wallets

body.text: What Launched, When, and How Fast

Slurmit The Frog appeared on Solana's Pump.fun-adjacent ecosystem within the last 24 hours. The token's name appears to riff on 'Slurm' — the fictional caffeinated beverage from Futurama, served by a giant alien worm — fused with the meme coin staple of frog imagery. Whether that's intentional branding or random Solana chaos is unclear, but it hit. Within hours of launch, the token was moving $3.3M daily volume with nearly 45K individual transactions — a transaction count that suggests genuine retail participation, not just a few coordinated wallets.
Let's not mistake velocity for value. Here's what the chain is actually showing at time of publication:

Slurmit sits at a $728K market cap — micro by any standard — with $78K in liquidity against $3.3M in volume. That's a volume-to-liquidity ratio of roughly 42:1. On a normal day that would flag a red light. On a viral Solana meme launch day, it's more common than you'd think. The 56% buy pressure across 44,649 transactions suggests retail is still piling in rather than rotating out, but the margin is thin. One coordinated dump from an early wallet could flip this quickly.

Honest answer: it might not be. Solana launches a dozen frog coins a week. Most die within 48 hours. But a few signals here are worth watching: First, the transaction count at 44K+ is organically high. Bots generate volume, but transaction spread like this usually requires real users clicking buttons. Second, the frog meme meta on Solana never fully lost its cultural cache — Pepe remains relevant on Ethereum, and Solana's community has historically embraced frog-adjacent tokens with religious fervor. Slurmit's 'Slurm + frog' angle is at minimum a distinctive concept in a crowded field. Third, the +1,931% launch spike without an immediate implosion — as of this writing — suggests some degree of coordinated community holding rather than pure pump-and-dump execution.

flags: Liquidity at $78K is thin relative to $3.3M volume — large buys or sells will have significant slippage
Market cap of $728K means a $72K whale exit could drop price 10%+ instantly
No verified team, doxxed developers, or official social presence confirmed yet
Buy ratio at 56% — barely above neutral. Distribution could be happening alongside retail buying
Pump.fun origin means zero-cost launch with no vesting, no locks, no roadmap obligations
No audits. This is the raw frontier of Solana meme culture

body.text: At time of publication, no major KOL wallets have been identified as large early holders. The wallet distribution hasn't been publicly analyzed by major Solana on-chain trackers. What's clear is that the volume profile suggests multiple entry points across the 44K+ transaction count — this doesn't look like one whale running a script. Whether that means organic retail momentum or a well-disguised coordinated play is the $3.3M question.

Frog tokens have a legitimate cultural lineage in crypto. Pepe ($PEPE) turned a 4chan meme into a $5B market cap asset. Rare Pepe NFTs preceded the NFT boom. On Solana specifically, frog-adjacent tokens like Kermit-themed plays have repeatedly caught viral momentum. The community's affinity for green amphibians is not ironic — it's ritualistic. When a new frog emerges with genuine launch momentum, the ecosystem takes notice. Slurmit is riding that tailwind. Whether it has the community longevity to sustain past the initial launch window is another question entirely.

Mathematically, Slurmit is still at micro-cap territory. A $728K market cap with demonstrated volume has room to run if community momentum builds — but it also has nowhere to hide if early holders decide to exit. The next 12-24 hours will be critical: if the buy-sell ratio tips below 50%, expect a rapid liquidity drain. If KOL accounts start calling it on Crypto Twitter, expect a second wave. The gap between those two outcomes is razor thin.

items.question: What is Slurmit The Frog ($Slurmit)?
items.answer: Slurmit The Frog is a frog-themed meme coin launched on Solana's Pump.fun ecosystem within the last 24 hours. It surged +1,931% and generated $3.3M in trading volume across 44,649 transactions in its first day.

items.question: Is Slurmit The Frog safe to buy?
items.answer: Slurmit is a high-risk micro-cap meme token with no audits, no locked liquidity, and no verified team. Liquidity is $78K against $3.3M volume — a thin cushion. Only risk capital you can afford to lose entirely.

items.question: Why is Slurmit pumping so hard?
items.answer: The token benefits from frog meme meta momentum on Solana, combined with a distinctive 'Slurm' cultural reference and organic-looking transaction volume. Whether the pump sustains depends on community building in the next 24-48 hours.

items.question: What chain is Slurmit on?
items.answer: Slurmit The Frog ($Slurmit) is on the Solana blockchain, launched via the Pump.fun ecosystem.

items.question: What is the Slurmit market cap?
items.answer: At time of writing, Slurmit's market cap is approximately $728K with $78K in liquidity. This is micro-cap territory — high risk, high volatility.
